intro: Cynanchum trollii, commonly known as the Tibetan milkweed, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus Cynanchum. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, containing various alkaloids. Cynanchum trollii is adapted to harsh, arid environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
